Welcome! I’m David Laing. I write to share my learning, to give more life to ideas that I think are underappreciated, and to make it easier for my future friends to find me.

The most important thing I’ve ever written is my essay, If you’re good, you need to talk more.

I write commentaries on notable essays from around the web. My favourites are the ones on Sarah Perry’s idea of deep laziness, and Alyssa Vance’s idea of levels of action.

I write about books. See my review of Atomic Habits, and my summaries of The Righteous Mind and Gödel, Escher, Bach.

I write about my hobbies and passion projects. See everything I know about chess, how to use Roam as a slip-box, and Covers shouldn’t just be for musicians.

Lastly, I write notes. I think of them as atomic proto-essays, or mega-tweets, in the style of Andy Matuschak’s evergreen notes, which inspired both the content and form of this site. Here are a few that are on my mind:

  • The aesthetic bullseye
  • Tidy up so you can make a useful mess
  • The personal PhD
